key.name: debug-mode
key.description: When debug mode is enabled, logs are printed in the standard output where Guake as been launched

key.name: mouse-display
key.description: Appear on the mouse display. This overrides any setting in display_n.

key.name: display-n
key.description: Display to appear on if the mouse_display option is not set. If this is set to an invalid value (as in the case of removing a screen from a system), the invalid value is automatically updated to the current primary screen.

key.name: default-shell
key.description: Path to the default shell. Set to empty to use default user shell. If invalid path is set here, guake will fallback to user shell.

key.name: restore-tabs-startup
key.description: If true, when guake startup, it will restore tabs from previous session

key.name: restore-tabs-notify
key.description: If true, when guake restored the tabs, it will notify the user that the tabs has been restored

key.name: save-tabs-when-changed
key.summary: Automatically save tabs session when changed
key.description: If true, when tabs has changed (add / delete ...etc.), it will automatically saved the tabs session

key.name: use-login-shell
key.description: If true, the commands in terminal will be executed in a login shell.

key.name: use-trayicon
key.description: When true tray is visible.

key.name: workspace-specific-tab-sets
key.description: When true, each workspace gets their own set of tabs.

key.name: use-popup
key.description: When true, popup notifications will be shown when Guake starts.

key.name: prompt-on-quit
key.description: Ask for confirmation when quitting Guake.

key.name: prompt-on-close-tab
key.description: 0: Never 1: If process is running 2: Always. Also prompts on quit.

key.name: window-ontop
key.description: Makes guake window be on top of all other windows in the desktop.

key.name: window-refocus
key.description: Refocus window instead of closing.

key.name: tab-ontop
key.description: Makes tab bar on top of the Guake window. Per default, tabs appears bellow the terminal. Setting this to True will move the tab on top of the terminal. Requires a restart.

key.name: window-losefocus
key.summary: Determine if guake hides on lose focus.
key.description: If this property is set as true, guake will be hidden when the main window lose the focus (when Alt+Tab be pressed for example).

key.name: window-tabbar
key.description: When true, the tab bar is visible.

key.name: quick-open-enable
key.description: If this property is set as true, guake will open a text editor when the user does a Ctrl+Click on a filename printed in the terminal.

key.name: quick-open-command-line
key.summary: Command line pattern to start a editor.
key.description: This property gives the command line to execute when doing a Quick Open. You can enter the following python string pattern in it: '%(file_path)s' will be replaced with the full path to the captured filename, '%(line_number)s' will be replaced by the line number if found (set to the empty string otherwise).

key.name: quick-open-in-current-terminal
key.summary: Quick open the file in the current terminal.
key.description: If this property is set as true, guake will use the current terminal to execute the Quick open feature. Use if you want to inherit your terminal environment in your text editor

key.name: startup-script
key.summary: Startup script to execute when guake starts
key.description: This property allows you to execute a startup bash script each time guake starts. You can configure your initial tab settings within this script. Please see the command line argument of guake ('guake --help') for complete help.

key.name: start-fullscreen
key.description: When true, the program will start in fullscreen mode.

key.name: start-at-login
key.description: When true, the program will start upon GNOME login.

key.name: use-audible-bell
key.description: If true, the system alert sound will be played on a bell character.

key.name: window-width
key.description: Percent of the screen that will be used by guake terminal horizontally.

key.name: window-height
key.description: Percent of the screen that will be used by guake terminal vertically.

key.name: window-horizontal-displacement
key.description: Displace the window horizontally by a given amount of pixels.

key.name: window-vertical-displacement
key.description: Displace the window vertically by a given amount of pixels.

key.name: window-halignment
key.description: Place Guake at: 0: center, 1: left, 2: right

key.name: window-valignment
key.description: Place Guake at: 0: top, 1: bottom

key.name: use-scrollbar
key.description: When true, scrollbar is visible.

key.name: history-size
key.description: The number of scrollback lines to save in history.

key.name: infinite-history
key.description: Scrollback lines in history is infinite

key.name: scroll-output
key.description: If true, whenever there is new output in the terminal, it will scroll to the bottom.

key.name: scroll-keystroke
key.description: If true and a key is pressed, the terminal is scrolled to the bottom.

key.name: use-default-font
key.description: If true, Guake will use the GNOME monospace default font.

key.name: use-vte-titles
key.summary: Use terminal titles for tab naming
key.description: Any terminal program can set the terminal's title via special escape sequences. Some shells (e.g. bash) display user's prompt there (though you can adjust that to any arbitrary text in bashrc or similar) and update it automatically as the prompt changes. So you can have easy automatically updating meaningful tab titles with this option turned on.

key.name: set-window-title
key.summary: Set window title to current tab name
key.description: If true, Guake will update its window title from the current tab name. It is useful when you work with applications that use windows title, (keepass, automatic time tracker apps)

key.name: compat-backspace
key.description: Defines the behavior of backscape key.

key.name: compat-delete
key.description: Defines the behavior of delete key.

key.name: word-chars
key.summary: Characters that are considered "part of a word"
key.description: When selecting text by word, sequences of these characters are considered single words. Ranges can be given as "A-Z". Literal hyphen (not expressing a range) should be the first character given.

key.name: toolbar-visible-in-fullscreen
key.summary: If the tabs bar must be visible in fullscreen
key.description: Set it as false to enjoy guake's fullscreen.

key.name: focus-if-open
key.summary: Give focus to guake if tab is opened (OBSOLETE).
key.description: If the guake window is out of focus but open, enabling this will give it back the focus instead of closing the window.

key.name: custom-command-file
key.summary: Path to the default custom command json file.
key.description: Path to the default custom command json file. If is blank or the json file is not in a proper format the terminal context menu will be built without custom commands. If the file is a valid json with recognized structure theterminak context menu will be buit with the commands read inside.
